intro: Icacorea sanmartensis, commonly known as the San Martín icacure, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Icacorea sanmartensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within montane forests.
